results.title: Up in smoke
results.creator_credit: British Columbia Forest Service and Barbara Davies
results.brief_description: Forest fire fighting in mountainous British Columbia has been developed to the precision of a military operation. Shows the whole pattern of attack, from the time smoke is sighted until the outbreak is brought under control. Includes aerial and ground attack.

results.title: Up by Kosciusko's side
results.brief_description: The Snowy Mountains Scheme - its aims and scope; the main power stations and dams; planning and working on the Scheme; building the dams; drilling the rock tunnels; hydrographers and surveyors at work; the hydraulics laboratory; construction towns; remote camps supplied by air; the men of the Scheme and the pioneering spirit among them.

results.title: Up against the system
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George C. Stoney and Terence Macartney-Filgate
results.brief_description: People on welfare are rarely heard. What do they go through? How do they feel? How do concerned social and welfare workers feel about the welfare system? What is welfare supposed to do? In this film, welfare recipients and social case workers talk about the problems of being “up against the system.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, George C. Stoney and Terence Macartney-Filgate

results.title: Up against it
results.creator_credit: Henley Beach Mural Collective and Cath Cantlon
results.brief_description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.

results.title: Up a tree
results.brief_description: Donald the lumberjack decides to saw down the tree in which Chip ‘n’ Dale live. A whirlwind of comedy ensues as the chipmunks proceed to deter the determined duck in any way they can.

results.title: Up
results.brief_description: A beautifully photographed non-narrated depiction of a hang glider’s majestic flight through the Rocky Mountains, Sierra Nevada and Alaskan mountain peaks - whose journey sees him pick up a young hitchiker, but fateful end is witnessed solely by a lone eagle. Winner of Academy Award for Live Action Short Film.
results.description: A beautifully photographed non-narrated depiction of a hang glider’s majestic flight through the Rocky Mountains, Sierra Nevada and Alaskan mountain peaks - whose journey sees him pick up a young hitchiker, but fateful end is witnessed solely by a lone eagle. results.title: Unusual artists
results.brief_description: Extraordinary painter: Earl Bailly, a Nova Scotia artist, holds the brush with his teeth. Sculptures in ice: Montreal chefs chip and chisel to see who can carve the prize-winning sculpture from a block of ice. Portraits in wool: Elizabeth Lefort keeps alive an ancient Acadian craft, creating beautiful tapestries.

results.title: Untitled: five Australian artists
results.brief_description: The work of five contemporary Australian sculptors - Tony Trembath, Ian Bracegirdle, Ross Grounds, Paul Stevenson-Ryan and Ray Woolard. The sculptors talk about their avant-garde sculptures, and see them as reflections on today’s society. They cite ecology, conservation and preserving the past as being important motivators in their work, and see their art as a way of living out their fantasies
